THRIVE Reading List

Navigating Academia

  • Decolonizing Academia: Poverty, Oppression and Pain by Clelia O. Rodríguez, ISBN: 9781773630748
  • Surviving Your Stupid Stupid Decision to Go to Grad School by Adam Ruben, ISBN: 9780307589446
  • Real Life by Brandon Taylor (fiction), ISBN: 9780525538882

Workbooks and Mental Health Books

  • The Queer and Transgender Resilience Workbook by Anneliese A. Singh, ISBN: 9781626259461
  • The Gender Quest Workbook: A Guide for Teens and Young Adults Exploring Gender Identity by Rylan Jay Testa, Deborah Coolhart, and Jayme Peta, ISBN: 9781626252974
  • The Reflective Workbook for Partners of Transgender People: Your Transition as Your Partner Transitions by D.M. Maynard, ISBN: 9781785927720

Children’s and Illustrated Books

  • The Secret Lives of Scientists, Engineers, and Doctors: Volume 1 by Faisal Hossain, ISBN: 9781645434450
  • Introducing Teddy: A Gentle Story About Gender and Friendship by Jess Walton and illustrated by Dougal MacPherson, ISBN: 9781681192109
  • When Aidan Became A Brother by Kyle Lukoff and illustrated by Kaylani Juanita, ISBN: 9781620148372
  • It Feels Good to Be Yourself: A Book About Gender Identity by Theresa Thorn and illustrated by Noah Grigni, ISBN: 9781250302953

LGBTQ+ YA Fiction

  • I am J by Cris Beam, ISBN: 9780316053617
  • Beautiful Music fo Ugly Children by Kirstin Cronn-Mills, ISBN: 9780738732510
  • Huntress by Malinda Lo, ISBN: 9780316040075
  • Will Grayson, Will Grayson by John Green and David Levithan, ISBN: 9780525421580
  • Little & Lion by Brandy Colbert, ISBN: 9780316349000
  • Felix Ever After by Kacen Callender, ISBN: 9780062820259
  • Stay Gold by Tobly McSmith, ISBN: 9780062943194
  • Openly Straight Series
    • Openly Straight by Bill Konigsberg (Book 1), ISBN: 9780545509893
    • Openly, Honestly by Bill Konigsberg (Book 1.5), ISBN: 9781338171280
    • Honestly Ben by Bill Konigsberg (Book 2), ISBN: 9780545858267
  • Simon Snow Series
    • Carry On by Rainbow Rowell (Book 1), ISBN: 9781250135025
    • Wayward Son by Rainbow Rowell (Book 2), ISBN: 9781250146076
    • Any Way the Wind Blows by Rainbow Rowell (Book 3; Anticipated 2021), ISBN: 9781250254337

Anti-Racist Literature

  • So You Want to Talk About Race by Ijeoma Oluo, ISBN: 9781580056779
  • White Fragility: Why It’s So Hard for White People to Talk About Racism by Robin DiAngelo, ISBN: 9780807071168
  • The Color of Law: A Forgotten History of How Our Government Segregated America by Richard Rothstein, ISBN: 9781631492853
  • Superior: The Return of Race Science by Angela Saini, ISBN: 9780807076910

Non-fiction

  • Trans* in College: Transgender Students’ Strategies for Navigating Campus Life and the Institutional Politics of Inclusion by Z. Nicolazzo, ISBN: 9781620364574
  • Beyond Magenta: Transgender Teens Speak Out by Susan Kuklin, ISBN: 9780763656119
  • Raising Them: Our Adventure in Gender Creative Parenting by Kyl Myers, ISBN: 9781542003681
  • Inferior: How Science Got Women Wrong—and the New Research That’s Rewriting the Story by Angela Saini, ISBN: 9780807071700
